intro: Hieracium leucoloma, commonly known as the white hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with white ray florets, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium leucoloma is often found in open habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
